titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jonathan Alexander Collection of Medieval Manuscripts MSS.356
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Martin

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-12-12 21:25:54 -0500.

change.item: Edited by Amy C. Vo for compliance with DACS and ACM Required Elements for Archival Description
Updated by Anna Bjornsson McCormick to reflect the rehousing of materials

did.unittitle: Jonathan Alexander Collection of Medieval Manuscripts

origination.label: Creator
origination.persname: Alexander, J. J. G. (Jonathan James Graham)

physdesc.extent: in one half manuscript box and one oversized flat box

did.abstract: Jonathan Alexander was a Professor of Fine Arts at New York University from 1988 until his retirement in 2011. This collection consists of medieval manuscript leaves collected by Jonathan Alexander, and date from the 15th to 16th centuries. The majority of these manuscripts are in Latin and are Biblical in nature. Additionally, there is a leaf from Titus Livius's history of Rome and a charter from Edward IV.
did.langmaterial: The materials are primarily in Latin, with some English.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection, which were created from 1436 to 1600, are in the public domain. Permission to publish or reproduce is not required.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The Jonathan Alexander Collection of Medieval Manuscripts was acquired by NYU's Fales Library and Special Collections by donation from Jonathan Alexander, 2012. The accession number associated with this gift is 2012.356.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Jonathan Alexander Collection of Medieval Manuscripts; MSS 356; box number; folder number or item identifier; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Jonathan Alexander was a Professor of Fine Arts at New York University from 1988 until his retirement in 2011.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of medieval manuscript leaves collected by Jonathan Alexander, and date from the 15th to 16th centuries. The majority of these manuscripts are in Latin and are Biblical in nature. Additionally, there is a leaf from Titus Livius's history of Rome and a charter from Edward IV.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Decisions regarding arrangement, description, and physical interventions for this collection prior to 2021 are unknown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Leaf from a Choir Book with fine penwork initials.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Purchased by Jonathan Alexander in Rome, Fall 1990.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Leaf from a Choir Book with fine penwork initials.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Purchased by Jonathan Alexander in Rome, Fall 1990.

did.unittitle: 2 leaves from a small Book of Hours. Sext and Vespers

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: From Genoa. From a manuscript with the colophon: Albericus Spinula fecit. Ugo Alexandrinus miniavit. Other leaves are in the donation of Mary and Richard Rouse to UCLA.

did.unittitle: Charter of Edward IV. License to William Dodesham and Philip Pymme to grant the Manor of Codecombe Mohun, Somerset, to Thomas Melt and other on payment to royal hanaper of 5 marks

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Purchased by Jonathan Alexander at Sotheby's, 29 Nov 1990, lot 00.

did.unittitle: Leaf of Calendar from a Book of Hours

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Framed by cordeliers. Mounted on cardboard. Fine small hand.

did.unittitle: Leaf from Psalter: Psalm: Adhesit pavimento. French

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Purchased in Paris by Jonathan Alexander.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Purchased from N. N. Pavlov, New York Antiquarian Book Fair, 1991.
